quotes.quote: My crown is called content, a crown that seldom kings enjoy.
Old age: the crown of life, our play's last act.
A crown is merely a hat that lets the rain in.
A sorrow's crown of sorrow is remembering happier times.
The crown of life is neither happiness nor annihilation; it is understanding.
Give way to your opponent; thus will you gain the crown of victory.
A crown, if it hurts us, is not worth wearing.
Uneasy lies the head that craves the crown.
If every fool wore a crown, we should all be kings.
Compassion crowns the soul with its truest victory.
Crowns do queer things to the heads beneath them.
Any man worth his salt has by the time he is forty-five accumulated a crown of thorns, and the problem is to learn to wear it over one ear.
To gain a crown by fighting is great, to reject it divine.
A crown, golden in show is but a wreath of thorns.
Popularity is the crown of laurel which the world puts on bad art. Whatever is popular is wrong.
By common consent gray hairs are a crown of glory the only object of respect that can never excite envy.
To be a king and wear a crown is a thing more glorious to them that see it than it is pleasant to them that bear it.
To wear the crown of peace, you must wear the crown of thorns.
A crown is more discomfort than adornment. If you have learned that, you have already learned much.
He that has no cross will have no crown.
A good woman is worth, if she were sold, the fairest crown that's made of purest gold.
Many commit the same crimes with a very different result. One bears a cross for his crime; another a crown.
No pain, no palm; no thorns, no throne; no gall, no glory; no cross, no crown.
Wear a crown of flowers on your head, let its roots reach your heart.
Idleness is the beginning of all vice, the crown of all virtues.
A crown is a pitiless master, harsher than the staff of a pig-keeper; while a staff bears up, a crown weighs down, beyond the strength of any man to wear it lightly.
If there be no enemy there’s no fight. If no fight, no victory and if no victory there is no crown.
A chaplet of leaves crowns the victor.
He who has put a good finish to his undertaking is said to have placed a golden crown to the whole.
Integrity of life is fame's best friend, which nobly, beyond death, shall crown in the end.
As a king can wear a crown, a crown can also weary a king.
Being made in the image of God, man was the crown of creation.
Though triumphs were to generals only due, crowns were reserved to grace the soldiers too.
